title: Tokaji - Wikipedia
snippet: Tokaji (Hungarian: of Tokaj Hungarian pronunciation: [ˈtokɒji]) or Tokay is a rich, sweet wine originating in the Tokaj wine region (also Tokaj-Hegyalja wine region or Tokaj-Hegyalja) in Hungary and in Slovakia.

title: Sweet and Sophisticated: The Story of Tokaji Wine
snippet: Tokaji wines are sweet, sophisticated, and historically sought. They tell a compelling story of Hungary's role in the modern history of wine.

title: Tokaji Aszú: The Story of The World’s Oldest Sweet Wine
snippet: Dec 10, 2018 · Tokaj is Hungary’s most famous wine region and a beautiful part of the country to explore. The area retained more independence way back during the Ottoman occupation, and traditions here are strong and deep.

title: Tokaji: Hungary’s Golden Secret – SOMM&SOMM - sommandsomm.com
snippet: Jan 25, 2026 · But Tokaji is older, deeper, more versatile, and—dare I say—more soulful. If you’re a wine lover with even a passing interest in history, sweetness balanced by acid, or hidden gems that reward curiosity, Tokaji isn’t intimidating at all.

title: Tokaji decoded: the science behind Hungary’s iconic sweet wines
snippet: Dec 9, 2024 · Few wines can claim a legacy as rich as Tokaji. Hailing from Hungary’s Tokaj region—one of the world’s first officially classified wine regions—these sweet, golden-hued wines have graced the tables of kings and inspired poets for centuries.
